result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   This case is dismissed, but read into 16CF147.

DE appears in court, by video from custody.  Atty McLaughlin appears in court.  Bruce Poquette appears for the State of WI.  Atty McLaughlin makes statement.  Plea/Sentencing scheduled for December 8, 2016 10:30 am.
Atty Aasen called at 11:22  indicating she was in a blizzard and stuck at the ER in Fort Yates, ND.

Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Aasen has failed to appear.  Court addressed DE.  Also has 16 CF 50, 156 CF 147, 15 CF 163 and 16 CF 35.   Court advised DE that Atty McLaughlin will come over and speak to him.  DE wishes to have Ms. Aasen removed from the case and Atty McL as atty.  Court will release Ms. Aasen and Mr. McLaughlin will go speak to the DE when he is finished with court today.  Review scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 08:00 am.  Review scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on December 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD:  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court with attorney Susan Elizabeth Aasen.  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Aasen states she will be taking over the cases.  15 CF 85, 15 CF 163, 16 CF 35, 16 CF 50 and 16 CF 147.  Court makes stmt. 
2:37 Pm  On the record court calls all cases and recites appearances.  Court - makes stmt as to previous conversation with Atty Johansen.  Court addressed the DE as to his attorney.  DE wishes to have Atty Aasen represent him.  Court Atty Johansen is allowed to w/draw and Atty Aasen is substituted as attorney of record.  Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for today, was not held.    Off the record - new date assigned  plea/sentence hearing if no agreement reached bond modification hearing to be held  9/1/2016  @ 10:45 AM

Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court with attorney Jesse Johansen appeared by phone (Special Appearance).  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in custody.   Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders DEF to contact Public Defender office to update financial information.   
OFF THE RECORD:  For DEF and Attorney to speak.    Attny Johansen to file motion for bond modification.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Changed to a Cash Bond

Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court, in custody appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Warrant quashed.   SIBS $1000 reinstated,  Court ordered new bond  CBS $2,500  No Special Conditions  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Jesse Johansen in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests warrants and bail forfeiture proceedings to begin.  Court grants warrants ordered and bail forfeiture to begin.

Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court and in custody with attorney Jesse Johansen.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Atty Johansen acknowledges receipt of information waived reading and requests STC be set and NG pleas entered.  Court not guilty entered.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court with attorney Jesse Johansen.  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johansen waived prelim.  Court advised the DE as to his right to prelim.  DE does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Atty Johansen requests bail modification.  State addressed the court.

COURT:  Bail modified  Arraignment scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Larimore has a conflict with the case as he represents a co-defendant of this case and moves to be removed from case.  Court questions defendant if he wants to proceed to prelim today as defendant requested the prelim in 10 days.  Defendant waives the time limits and wants an attorney present.  Court grants request for attorney Larimore to be removed from case.  Case to be reset.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
